meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or effort.
meanings.sent1: The slackers in the office always find excuses to avoid their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The group of slackers at the park lounged around all day without doing anything productive.
meanings.sent3: The slackers decided to take a nap instead of helping with the project.
meanings.sent4: The team's success was hindered by the presence of slackers who refused to contribute.
meanings.sent5: The image of the slackers lazing on the couch is etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are lazy or unproductive.
meanings.sent1: We need to address the issue of the slackers in our team to improve productivity.
meanings.sent2: The slackers in the neighborhood always leave their chores unfinished.
meanings.sent3: The slackers at the party preferred sitting around rather than dancing.
meanings.sent4: The company's growth was stunted by a culture that tolerated slackers.
meanings.sent5: The slackers in the group chat never respond on time.

meanings.sent1: I tend to slack off on weekends and just relax at home.
meanings.sent2: Don't slack on your responsibilities; complete them on time.
meanings.sent3: He decided to slack during the meeting and missed important information.
meanings.sent4: If you continue to slack in your studies, your grades will suffer.
meanings.sent5: She chose to slack instead of helping her friends with the project.
